translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Dhamma-based Pairs, the Text in Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sa ārammaṇa duka
translated: The Pairs on Having a Physical Object🔽With a physical object as condition there arises what is without a physical object.

original: Nasārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasārammaṇaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: na sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa ārammaṇa  dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca
translated: With a physical object as condition there arises what is not a physical object.🔽With a physical object as condition there arise what is with a physical object and what is not a physical object.

original: nasārammaṇo ca naanārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naanārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanārammaṇaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca nasārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: na sārammaṇaḥ ca na anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na anārammaṇa  dhammam paṭicca na sārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca
translated: With what is not a physical object as condition there arises what is not a physical object.🔽With what is not a physical object as condition there arises what is with a physical object.🔽With what is not a physical object as condition there arise what is with a physical object and what is not a physical object.

original: nasārammaṇo ca naanārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nasārammaṇañca naanārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na sārammaṇaḥ ca na anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā 🔽na sa ārammaṇañca na anārammaṇañca dhammam paṭicca na sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With what is with a physical object and what is not a physical object as condition there arises what is with a physical object.

original: Nasārammaṇañca naanārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na sārammaṇam ca na anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object of the nose and with an object of different kinds …

original: Nasārammaṇañca naanārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasārammaṇo ca naanārammaṇo ca dhammā
analyzed: na sa ārammaṇam ca na anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca na sa ārammaṇaḥ ca na anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With an object of the nose and with an object of different kinds …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… aññamaññe cha …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā pañca pe aññamaññe cha pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: Nine in the cause; three in the object; five in the dominant; … in the support, six; … in the prior, one; … in the proximate, one; … in the condition, nine. (In all sections, the method is the same as in the preceding section.)
